001package imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.nonlinear;
002
003import static java.lang.Math.cos;
004import static java.lang.Math.exp;
005import static java.lang.Math.hypot;
006import static java.lang.Math.log;
007import static java.lang.Math.sin;
008
009import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
010import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Inversion;
011import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
012import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
013
014/**
015 * <p>
016 * This class implements a 2D log-polar mapping transformation. Improved version
017 * (Version 2), maps radius [rmin,rmax] to [0,nr]). See Sec. 21.1.6 (Eq 21.71 -
018 * 21.74, Alg. 21.1) of [1] for additional details and examples.
019 * </p>
020 * <p>
021 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
022 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
023 * </p>
024 * 
025 * @author WB
026 * @version 2022/11/16
027 */
028public class LogPolarMapping2 implements Mapping2D, Inversion {
029        
030        private static final double PI2 = 2 * Math.PI;
031        
032        private final double rmin;              // min. radius
033        private final double xc, yc;    // center point in source image
034        private final double c1, c2;    // pre-calculated constants
035        
036        /**
037         * Constructor.
038         * @param xc x-coordinate of center point in source image
039         * @param yc y-coordinate of center point in source image
040         * @param P number of radial steps
041         * @param Q number of angular steps
042         * @param rmax maximum radius
043         * @param rmin minimum radius
044         */
045        public LogPolarMapping2(double xc, double yc, int P, int Q, double rmax, double rmin) {
046                this.xc = xc;
047                this.yc = yc;
048                this.rmin = (rmin > 0) ? rmin : rmax / exp(2 * Math.PI * (P - 1) / Q);
049                this.c1 = P / log(rmax / rmin);
050                this.c2 = Q / PI2;
051        }
052                
053        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
054        
055        @Override
056        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d xy) {        // image -> log-polar
057                double dx = xy.getX() - xc;
058                double dy = xy.getY() - yc;
059                double r = hypot(dx, dy);               // = Math.sqrt(sqr(dx) + sqr(dy));
060                if (r < rmin) {
061                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("radius < rmin for xy = " + xy);     // this should not happen!
062                }
063                double rho = c1 * log(r / rmin);
064                double theta = Arithmetic.mod(Math.atan2(dy, dx), PI2); // theta in [0, 2 PI)
065                double omega = c2 * theta;
066                return Pnt2d.from(rho, omega);
067        }
068        
069        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
070        
071        @Override
072        public Mapping2D getInverse() {
073                return new Mapping2D() {        
074                        @Override
075                        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d rw) {        // log-polar -> image, rw = (rho, omega)
076                                double rho   = rw.getX();
077                                double omega = rw.getY();
078                                double r =  exp(rho / c1) * rmin;
079                                double theta = omega / c2;
080                                double x = xc + r * cos(theta);
081                                double y = yc + r * sin(theta);
082                                return Pnt2d.from(x, y);
083                        }
084                };
085        }
086        
087}
